aws::graph::propositions: Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for N4811G Accident
Conditions at the accident site were Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The lowest cloud condition was 25000 feet Above Ground Level (AGL).
The lowest ceiling was Broken at 25000 feet Above Ground Level (AGL).
The altimeter setting was 30.37 inches of mercury (Hg).
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was Poplar Grove, Illinois (C77).
The destination was Poplar Grove, Illinois (C77).
The engine was rated at 180 Horsepower.
The condition of light was Day.
The accident site was 14 Nautical Miles from the observation facility.
The direction from the accident site to the observation facility was 225 degrees.
The dew point was 2 degrees Celsius.
